explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1673 (o-,m-,p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1673 (o-,m-,p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 103-104degC (ICSC, 2002), test temperature: 140degC)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 510mg/kg, calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 510mg/kg, 3,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)), 660mg/kg and 1,284mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of dust) value of 0.15mg/L (4 hours) (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (CERI Hazard Data 99-3 (2000)): "mild irritation." Also based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "mildly irritating to the skin." The substance is thus classified as Category 3, though the results of a dermal irritation test in rabbits (4 hours) reported in DFGOT vol.6 (1994) suggest no irritation.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (DFGOT vol.6 (1994), CERI Hazard Data 99-3 (2000) and ACGIH (7th, 2001)): The substance produced "mild irritation." Also based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "irritating to the human eye."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the positive results in a number of skin sensitization studies with guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994)) and the evidence of skin sensitization in humans reported in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994). Furthermore due to the fact that the substance is classified as a "Skin Sensitizing Substance" by the ad hoc committee of the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy, and "Skin Sensitizing Substance: Group 1" by the Japan Society for Occupational Health.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity in vivo tests, and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests and chromosome aberration tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 99-3 (2000), DFGOT vol. 2 1 (2005) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on expert judgment since no evidence of reproductive toxicity was found in rat teratogenicity studies, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and PATTY (4th, 2000).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system) Category 2 (respiratory organs, nervous system, kidneys, muscle, liver)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "the substance is irritating to the eye; slightly irritating to the skin and respiratory tract; has effects on blood and may form methemoglobin" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "indifference, rhabdomyolysis, LDH - APAT -, elevated Aldolase Glutamat Amino Transferase, acute renal failure, popliteal discoloration, damage to the central nervous system/muscle/liver," "renal tubular degeneration, renal interstitial edema, hepatocyte necrosis and bronchial pneumonia," "auditory disturbance, dyspnea and nephropathy" (IUCLID (2000)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "methemoglobin formation" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), "ataxia, changes in salivary gland function or structure, and hematuria following dermal administration" (RTECS (2005)), "slight irritation of the nasal mucosa" (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "nasal congestion, nasal irritation, dyspnea, blood Heinz bodies," "angitis, right coronary artery infarction, pulmonary congestion, renal hypertrophy and glomerulonephritis" (IUCLID (2000)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.82mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=0.15(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
